snippet: Volunteer medical organizations said the vaccine afflicted dozens of children in insurgent-held areas of Idlib Province.
abstract: Improperly mixed or possibly sabotaged measles vaccine kills as many as 50 children in insurgent-held areas of Syria, forcing suspension of large-scale United Nations vaccination campaign intended to stop the spread of measles, rubella and polio.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon. Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Volunteer medical organizations said the vaccine afflicted dozens of children in insurgent-held areas of Idlib Province.

headline.main: Bad Vaccine Kills Dozens of Children Inside Syria
headline.print_headline: Bad Vaccine Kills Dozens of Children Inside Syria
